item.title: The Fallacy of one person, one vote
item.description: On October 6, 2018, the US Senate voted 50–48 in favor of the appointment of Associate Justice Brett Kavanaugh.

item.title: The Cost of Gridlock
item.description: Originally posted via Boston Area Research Initiative The nation heaved a sigh of relief as President Trump signed a bill on Friday, January 25th, that ended the longest government shutdown in US history.

item.title: US Representation: Part I
item.description: Before the United States created the Constitution, something called the Articles of Confederation defined what the US Government would look like.
